title: Album Page, "Architectural Details, Basel", September 27, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, clockwise from top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 58 / 70; dormer; fountain spout; Basel / Sept 27th 1887; Dormer with gutter / around it and small gargoyle in middle / of front; gargoyle; curious windows; top of door; The ends of scrolls here/ are curls.
description: Vertical sheet with numerous sketches of architectural elements.  Clockwise from bottom left: a dormer with ogee-shaped roof, gutter, and small gargoyle spout at the corner.  This same spout is drawn to the left.  Above this is a horizontal fountain spout in the shape of a man blowing into a pipe.  In the top half of the sheet are three sketches: below left is a window made of five round-arched lancets that graduate in size. The window is flanked by louvered shutters.  Above is the arched top of a doorway filled with greyish black scrolling ironwork.  At right is a dormer with a tiled roof that cantilevers far over the window opening below it.  The cantilever is supported by ogee brackets on either side of the window.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Architectural Details, Basel", September 27, 1887.
September 27, 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-138.
